meanings.definition: (verb) to cause a group of people or animals to run in a wild, uncontrolled manner
meanings.sent1: The loud noise stampeded the herd of cows.
meanings.sent2: The hunters stampeded the elephants by mistake.
meanings.sent3: The clown's funny dance stampeded the audience out of the tent.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected announcement stampeded the stock market.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm stampeded the picnic crowd to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: (noun) a sudden, frenzied rush of a group of people or animals
meanings.sent1: The stampeded caused chaos in the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: The stampeded at the concert was triggered by a false alarm.
meanings.sent3: The stampeded for limited edition toys was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The stampeded of fans towards the stage was like a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The stampeded of shoppers on Black Friday was unforgettable.
